greetings-description: A fullstack developer passionate about what I do, constantly studying and practicing to develop innovative solutions
experience-subtitle: Take a look at what I've been up to
fcamara-p1: Currently, I'm a trainee at FCamara, a brazilian IT consultancy with a strong presence in multiple sectors, such as health, finances, retail and more!
fcamara-p2: My journey with FCamara started early in 2024, when I took part in a hackathon disputed by 200 candidates, where I could work together with other four developers and show my problem solving skills.
rocketseat-p1: Recently, with the goal of improving further as a developer, I started my Fullstack Development MBA at Rocketseat and Sirius.
rocketseat-p2: During the course, I'll be exploring technologies for front-end, back-end and mobile development as well as soft skills, and I will develop projects to solidify my skills.
unasp-p1: In August 2023 I graduated in Information Systems at UNASP on the Hortol√¢ndia campus, in the interior of S√£o Paulo.
unasp-p2: During the four years of the course, I studied technical skills that gave me the necessary base to excel at software development, as well as business and soft skills that prepared me to understand and face the challenges of the IT industry.
projects-subtitle: Take a look at some of my favorite projects
link-github: üë®‚Äçüíª Take a look at the source code:
coffee-delivery-alt: Image of a coffee delivery website
coffee-delivery-description: A SPA (Single Page Application) developed as a challenge in Rocketseat's React course. During development, features, libraries and tools available in the React ecosystem were used, such as Styled Components, Hooks, Contexts and Reducers. The application also has a responsive layout, adapting to different screen sizes.
orange-branch-task-manager-description: A Web API developed with C# during FCamara's Orange Branch program, under the mentorship of Kaique Lira. The purpose of this API is to register users and simple tasks, which are stored in a MySQL database. After some actions, a notification is sent via email, for this to happen, RabbitMQ is used to communicate between the API and a worker that observes the queue in RabbitMQ and sends emails. In this project, I strived to follow Clean Architecture and SOLID standards, and also developed unit tests for business logic.
orange-tasks-alt: Image of a task management website
orange-tasks-description: This is the front-end of Orange Branch Task Manager, built with React, TypeScript, Tailwind and other technologies. The objective was to have an interface integrated with the API to facilitate access to its features.
